name: Analogue Pocket
searchTerms: best sd card for analogue pocket
whySpecs: The Analogue Pocket uses the SD card primarily for 'OpenFPGA' cores and ROM storage. While high transfer speeds aren't required for gameplay (as games are loaded into RAM), a high-quality card is essential to prevent data corruption during core updates and firmware installation.

faq.q: What format should the card be?
faq.a: The card should be formatted to exFAT (preferred) or FAT32. Analogue OS officially supports exFAT, which is easier for managing large files and modern operating systems.

faq.q: Do I need a fast SD card?
faq.a: Not strictly for gameplay. The Pocket loads the game into its internal FPGA memory before playing. Speed only matters when initially copying your library to the card.

notes: Essential for OpenFPGA users. Official firmware updates also require an SD card.

name: Sony PS Vita (SD2Vita)
whySpecs: The PS Vita natively uses proprietary memory, but modded units use the 'SD2Vita' adapter to utilize standard microSD cards. 128GB or 256GB is the 'sweet spot'. Cards larger than 256GB effectively require formatting with a 64kb cluster size to prevent wastage.

faq.q: Does this work on a normal PS Vita?
faq.a: No. You must install custom firmware (Henkaku/Enso) to use the SD2Vita adapter. A stock, unmodded Vita cannot read microSD cards.

faq.q: What is the max size for SD2Vita?
faq.a: 512GB is widely considered the practical maximum. While 1TB cards theoretically work, they often cause slowness in the Vita's UI (LiveArea) due to the sheer number of icons/bubbles to load.

notes: Requires 'SD2Vita' adapter (cheaply available online). Formatting must be done via the Vita or strict settings on PC.

name: Anbernic RG556
whySpecs: The RG556 is an Android-based handheld capable of emulating PS2 and GameCube. Using a high-capacity card (256GB+) is recommended to store these large disc-based ROM files. A1 speed is recommended for Android app performance.

faq.a: No, the RG556 has a single TF (microSD) slot. Unlike older Anbernic devices with two slots, you store both your OS specific files and ROMs on this single card (or internal storage).

notes: Also applies to the Anbernic RG Cube.
